intro: Arthropteris dolichopoda, commonly known as the long-leaf water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically green and often have a bluish tinge. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its rhizomes are creeping and help in the propagation of the plant. Arthropteris dolichopoda plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
